授業目的: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following.
到達目標: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following.
特記事項: この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。
関連科目: None. It is expected that the student is not a complete beginner to be in this course. The student should be confident with the English a typical Japanese student learns in junior high school and senior high school.
授業の概要・背景: This course is designed to help students gain greater exposure to the TOEIC exam as well as gain a grasp of the subtle nuances of the test. By the end of the course, students should feel confident taking the exam due to their extensive exposure to all its various components. This course meets once a week.
授業方法:
In principle this is a face-to-face course.

Students will learn in a variety of modes. These modes will include individual work, collaborative learning in pairs and small groups, and traditional test preparation methods.

第1回:
Course introduction.
About the test and how to study.
Set up of vocabulary study component.
第14回:
Course review.
Make up tests or corrections.
University questionnaires.
Teacher feedback.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will work outside of class equal to the time in class over the semester. This means for this class expect to spend at least 60-90 minutes a week doing class preparation, studying for tests, and other general preparation. For any particular week this time may be more or less depending on the week in the semester. Please consult the class by class outline below.

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: 60% Unit Tests (3x20), 20% Homework and Preparation 20%, Participation

name: 【250】Skills-based English(TOEIC)L3　１／Skills-based English(TOEIC) L3
